description: Supplementary variants to merge with kb.json - brings total to 150+

interpretation.plain_language: Additional 9p21 variant associated with myocardial infarction and coronary artery disease risk.
limitations: Risk independent of traditional cardiovascular risk factors

interpretation.plain_language: Strong LPA variant associated with very high Lp(a) levels and significantly increased coronary artery disease risk.
PCSK9 variant affecting LDL receptor degradation. PCSK9 inhibitors are a major class of cholesterol-lowering drugs.
limitations: May influence response to PCSK9 inhibitor therapy

interpretation.plain_language: CXCL12 variant associated with coronary artery disease risk through inflammatory pathways.
Additional 9p21 locus variant contributing to coronary artery disease risk.
Beta-fibrinogen variant associated with elevated fibrinogen levels and increased thrombotic risk.
Platelet glycoprotein IIIa variant associated with increased platelet aggregation and potentially reduced aspirin response.
Paraoxonase 1 variant affecting HDL antioxidant function and organophosphate metabolism.
Sodium channel variant associated with cardiac conduction abnormalities and arrhythmia susceptibility.
limitations: ECG screening may be warranted if symptomatic

interpretation.plain_language: SLC45A2 variant affecting melanin synthesis and skin/hair pigmentation.
MC1R variant associated with red hair phenotype and increased melanoma risk.
Another MC1R variant contributing to red hair/fair skin phenotype.
limitations: Multiple MC1R variants typically needed for red hair phenotype

interpretation.plain_language: KITLG variant associated with blonde hair color in Europeans.
limitations: Hair color determined by many genes

interpretation.plain_language: European lactase persistence variant in strong LD with rs4988235.
ACE I/D polymorphism associated with endurance (I) vs power (D) athletic performance.
limitations: Athletic performance determined by many factors

interpretation.plain_language: Collagen type I variant associated with Achilles tendon and ACL injury susceptibility.
limitations: Proper training and conditioning more important than genetics

interpretation.plain_language: Part of the TAS2R38 haplotype determining bitter taste perception (PAV vs AVI).
limitations: Combined with other TAS2R38 SNPs for phenotype prediction

interpretation.plain_language: Olfactory receptor variant determining ability to detect asparagus metabolites in urine.
OCA2 haplotype variant contributing to eye color variation, particularly green/hazel eyes.
Tyrosinase variant associated with freckling tendency.
MC1R V92M variant with modest effect on pigmentation.
limitations: Weaker effect than other MC1R variants

interpretation.plain_language: EDAR variant affecting hair thickness and other ectodermal traits.
limitations: More common in East Asian populations

interpretation.plain_language: EDAR V370A affects multiple ectodermal traits including hair thickness, sweat gland density, and tooth morphology.
Androgen receptor variant associated with male pattern baldness.
Additional androgen receptor variant contributing to baldness susceptibility.
PAX3 variant associated with eyebrow hair pattern.
ADH1B*2 variant causes rapid alcohol metabolism, creating unpleasant effects that protect against alcohol use disorder.
Oxytocin receptor variant associated with social anxiety and attachment style.
limitations: Behavioral genetics explains only fraction of variance

interpretation.plain_language: DRD4 promoter variant associated with novelty-seeking personality trait.
limitations: Personality is highly polygenic and environmental

GG.label: Short allele - more reactive to environment

interpretation.plain_language: 5-HTTLPR functional variant affecting serotonin transporter expression. 'Short' allele carriers may be more susceptible to environmental influences (both positive and negative).
Serotonin 2A receptor variant potentially affecting mood and antidepressant response.
Voltage-gated calcium channel variant associated with bipolar disorder and other mood conditions.
Tryptophan hydroxylase 2 variant affecting serotonin synthesis in the brain.
Tryptophan hydroxylase 1 variant affecting peripheral serotonin synthesis.
FUT2 secretor status affects gut microbiome composition, B12 absorption, and susceptibility to certain infections.
CYP2R1 variant affecting 25-hydroxylation of vitamin D.
limitations: Sun exposure and supplementation more important than genetics

interpretation.plain_language: DHCR7 variant affecting vitamin D3 synthesis from 7-dehydrocholesterol.
limitations: Testing vitamin D levels more informative than genotype

interpretation.plain_language: Cystathionine beta-synthase variant affecting homocysteine metabolism and transsulfuration pathway.
PEMT variant affecting endogenous choline synthesis. Women with this variant may be more susceptible to choline deficiency.
limitations: Effect more pronounced in premenopausal women

interpretation.plain_language: Additional PEMT variant affecting choline synthesis capacity.
limitations: Eggs and liver are good dietary choline sources

interpretation.plain_language: TMPRSS6 variant affecting iron-regulatory hormone hepcidin, associated with lower iron and hemoglobin levels.
limitations: May contribute to iron deficiency anemia risk

CC.label: High saturated fat intake may increase BMI and reduce HDL

interpretation.plain_language: APOA2 variant affecting response to dietary saturated fat. CC genotype individuals may benefit more from saturated fat restriction.
CD36 variant affecting oral fat sensing. Lower sensitivity may lead to overconsumption of fatty foods.
FADS2 variant affecting desaturase activity and conversion of essential fatty acids.
limitations: Direct EPA/DHA intake bypasses conversion limitation

interpretation.plain_language: MTRR variant affecting vitamin B12 utilization and homocysteine metabolism.
limitations: B12 and folate supplementation can help

interpretation.plain_language: CD226 variant associated with type 1 diabetes and other autoimmune conditions.
limitations: One of many autoimmune risk variants

interpretation.plain_language: NAA25 region variant contributing to type 1 diabetes susceptibility.
limitations: One of many T1D risk variants

interpretation.plain_language: BACH2 variant associated with systemic lupus erythematosus and other autoimmune conditions.
IL-10 promoter variant affecting anti-inflammatory cytokine production.
TNF-alpha variant associated with psoriasis susceptibility.
limitations: TNF inhibitors are effective psoriasis treatment

interpretation.plain_language: PTPN22 region variant associated with rheumatoid arthritis and other autoimmune diseases.
KCNQ1 potassium channel variant with strong diabetes association, particularly in East Asian populations.
Additional MC4R variant contributing to obesity susceptibility through appetite dysregulation.
limitations: Weight management effective regardless of genotype

interpretation.plain_language: CLOCK gene variant affecting circadian rhythm and metabolic regulation. Associated with evening preference and weight gain.
limitations: Sleep hygiene more important than genetics

interpretation.plain_language: Beta-3 adrenergic receptor variant potentially affecting thermogenesis and weight loss response.

CC.label: Val162 - may respond better to Mediterranean diet

interpretation.plain_language: PPAR-alpha variant affecting response to dietary fat and potentially fibrate medications.
CYP2D6*4 is the most common nonfunctional allele in Europeans. Poor metabolizers have significantly altered drug responses.
limitations: Full CYP2D6 phenotyping requires multiple variants

interpretation.plain_language: CYP2C19*3 is a loss-of-function variant more common in Asian populations.
limitations: Consider with *2 status for overall phenotype

interpretation.plain_language: Additional CYP2D6 variant contributing to metabolizer status.
NAT2 variant affecting acetylator status. Slow acetylators have increased risk of isoniazid-induced hepatotoxicity and may require dose adjustment.
NAT2 variant contributing to acetylator phenotype. Affects metabolism of isoniazid, sulfonamides, hydralazine, and caffeine.
limitations: Combined with other NAT2 variants for phenotype

interpretation.plain_language: TPMT*3C variant causing enzyme deficiency. CRITICAL: Deficient individuals at severe risk of life-threatening myelosuppression from thiopurines.
CYP2B6*6 affects metabolism of efavirenz, nevirapine, methadone, and bupropion. Poor metabolizers may have higher drug levels and increased side effects.
limitations: Efavirenz CNS side effects more common in poor metabolizers

interpretation.plain_language: SLCO1B1*1b variant affecting hepatic statin uptake.
limitations: Combined effect with *5 determines overall function

interpretation.plain_language: P-glycoprotein variant affecting drug efflux. May affect levels of digoxin, immunosuppressants, and many other drugs.
CYP2D6*9 is a reduced function allele.
8q24 region variant associated with breast cancer risk.
Independent 8q24 prostate cancer risk variant.
limitations: Part of 8q24 prostate cancer risk region

interpretation.plain_language: 11q23 variant associated with colorectal cancer risk.
TP63 variant associated with bladder cancer susceptibility.
Additional bladder cancer susceptibility variant in TP63 region.
MTAP region variant associated with melanoma susceptibility.
Agouti signaling protein variant affecting pigmentation and melanoma risk.
GREM1 region variant associated with colorectal cancer risk.
BRCA1 missense variant with modest association to breast cancer risk. This is NOT a pathogenic BRCA1 mutation.
limitations: Not equivalent to pathogenic BRCA1 mutations

interpretation.plain_language: RAD51 variant affecting DNA double-strand break repair. May interact with BRCA2 mutations.
limitations: Clinical significance limited for non-BRCA carriers

ID.label: Carrier - healthy but can pass to children

interpretation.plain_language: F508del is the most common cystic fibrosis mutation (70% of CF alleles). Carriers are healthy but can have affected children if partner is also a carrier.
limitations: Partner testing important for family planning

interpretation.plain_language: Tay-Sachs carrier status. More common in Ashkenazi Jewish and French Canadian populations. Carriers are healthy.
limitations: Carrier screening recommended for at-risk populations

interpretation.plain_language: PKU carrier status. Newborn screening identifies affected infants, who require phenylalanine-restricted diet.
CFTR G551D is responsive to ivacaftor (Kalydeco). Important pharmacogenomic information for CF treatment.
limitations: Identifies patients who benefit from specific CF modulator therapy

interpretation.plain_language: Alpha-1 antitrypsin Z allele. ZZ homozygotes have severe deficiency causing early-onset COPD and liver disease. Smoking dramatically accelerates lung damage.
limitations: CRITICAL: ZZ individuals must never smoke

interpretation.plain_language: A1AT S variant causes milder deficiency than Z. SS or SZ compound heterozygotes may have moderate deficiency.
limitations: SZ compound heterozygotes at intermediate risk

interpretation.plain_language: GBA N370S is a Gaucher disease mutation. Importantly, carriers have ~5-fold increased Parkinson's disease risk.
limitations: Parkinson's risk significant even for carriers
Gaucher disease more common in Ashkenazi Jewish population

interpretation.plain_language: Bloom syndrome carrier status. Primarily found in Ashkenazi Jewish population. Carriers are healthy.
limitations: Partner testing important for at-risk couples
